function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Dependence on mass video surveillance for monitoring social distancing","Impact":"Privacy concerns, potential misuse of surveillance data","Mitigation":"Implement strict data privacy measures, obtain consent for surveillance, and have stringent regulations in place","Technologies":"Data encryption, anonymization techniques, consent management systems","People":"Citizens, especially those concerned about privacy","Owner":"Government, regulatory bodies, and tech companies"},{"Description":"High reliance on deep learning-based solutions for monitoring social distancing","Impact":"Technological failures, misinterpretation of data, and false alarms","Mitigation":"Continuous testing and validation of the deep learning models, human oversight and intervention, regular updates and maintenance of the system","Technologies":"Continuous model training, human-in-the-loop systems, anomaly detection algorithms","People":"Citizens, surveillance operators, and maintenance personnel","Owner":"Technology companies, surveillance operators, and maintenance personnel"},{"Description":"Potential normalization of mass surveillance in a sustainable smart city scenario","Impact":"Erosion of privacy rights, lack of transparency and accountability","Mitigation":"Critical evaluation of the societal implications, transparent communication with the public, and active participation of citizens in decision-making processes","Technologies":"Ethical AI frameworks, transparency and accountability tools, public participation platforms","People":"Citizens, privacy advocates, and policymakers","Owner":"Government, public advocacy groups, and civic organizations"}]}
